#### word order
reta Kanubi uses a default word order of subject-verb-object, but because of case-suffixes, the word order is not strict and can be modified for emphasis or effect-


#### proper adjectives 
instead of proper nouns, ret Kanubi uses a proper adjective system, with names modifying the nouns they represent-

#### noun case
suffixes for for nominative and accusative

- [[dictionary.Kanubi]]: relating to or of the language *ret Kanubi* 
- [[dictionary.mi]]: first person pronoun, ownership marker
- [[dictionary.ret]]: speech, language
- [[dictionary.thirdpersonpronoun]]: of course you have hair-object blue pronoun-object
- [[dictionary.imperative]]: particle that goes at the beginning of a sentence to make it imperative-

[ mi ]
*content* first person pronoun, marker of possession Esperanto
*mi* ‘I, me’ ← Romance m- ‘(1st person singular oblique)’
